definitions.definition: A type of soft leather, made from calfskin, with a brushed texture to resemble fabric, often used to make boots, clothing and fashion accessories.
To make (leather) into suede.
Made of suede
A school which crosses the traditional divide between primary school and secondary school
Natural large-scale and long-term change in the Earth's climatic system, as brought about by ice ages.
Large-scale and long-term change in the Earth's climatic system produced by global warming; anthropogenic climate change.
A metal.
Any of several types of plant.
A participant (fighter) in a boxing match.
definitions.example: You can tell she's a boxer by looking at her nose.

definitions.definition: A breed of stocky, medium-sized, short-haired dog with a square-jawed muzzle.
A type of internal combustion engine in which cylinders are arranged in two banks on either side of a single crankshaft.
The person running a game of two-up.
One who packs boxes.
A letterboxer.
Any reptile of the order Squamata that is not a snake, usually having four legs, external ear openings, movable eyelids and a long slender body and tail.
(chiefly in attributive use) Lizard skin, the skin of these reptiles.
An unctuous person.
A coward.

(rock paper scissors) A hand forming a "D" shape with the tips of the thumb and index finger touching (a handshape resembling a lizard), that beats paper and Spock and loses to rock and scissors in rock-paper-scissors-lizard-Spock.
(in compounds) A person who idly spends time in a specified place, especially a promiscuous female.
definitions.example: lounge lizard; lot lizard; beach lizard; truck stop lizard

definitions.definition: (grammar) A subordinate clause.
A subsidiary clause in a legal contract etc.
To qualify with a subclause.
Being the winner in a contest, struggle, war, etc.
Of or expressing a sense of victory or triumph.
definitions.example: The team were met with a victorious cheer.

definitions.definition: Characterized by very precise, conscientious attention to details.
Timid, fearful, overly cautious.
Any of various small wading birds of the family Scolopacidae.
Of or relating to chalk.
Consisting of chalk.
Next year; the year following the current year, especially the early part of it.
definitions.example: We hoped that things would be better in the new year.

definitions.definition: A form of punishment achieved by inflicting blows to the offender's body.
Motel
A crazed Norse warrior who fought in a frenzy; a berserker.
Injuriously, maniacally, or furiously violent or out of control.
definitions.example: After seeing his sister stabbed to death, he went berserk and attacked the killer like a wild animal.

definitions.definition: Weird; bizarre.
Of or pertaining to a shrew (a nagging, ill-tempered woman).
Bad-tempered; ill-natured; obstinate, as a shrew.
An error, especially one in a printed work.
A component that is part of a larger construction, such as a brick or a stone.
definitions.example: Cells are the building blocks of life.

definitions.definition: A block made of wood or plastic that is used as a children's toy and can be stacked or joined to form a larger structure.
Meat slow-cooked over an open fire, characteristic of Latin American cuisine.
A light, thin, flat biscuit/cookie.
(christianity) A thin disk of consecrated unleavened bread used in communion.
A soft disk originally made of flour, and later of gelatin or a similar substance, used to seal letters, attach papers etc.
A thin disk of silicon or other semiconductor on which an electronic circuit is produced.
To seal or fasten with a wafer.
Of or pertaining to the pancreas
An accessory that can be bolted on or otherwise attached.
A functionality or service that can be added to an existing arrangement or plan (for example, a mobile telephone subscription).
Of an accessory: capable of being bolted on or otherwise attached.
Used to extend an existing system, operating as an add-on or plug-in.
A wide bowl for washing, sometimes affixed to a wall
A shallow bowl used for a single serving of a drink or liquidy food
A depression, natural or artificial, containing water
An area of land from which water drains into a common outlet; drainage basin
A rock formation scooped out by water erosion
To create a concavity or depression in.
To serve as or become a basin.
To shelter or enclose in a basin.
To make (an animal) tame; to domesticate.
definitions.example: He tamed the wild horse.

definitions.definition: To become tame or domesticated.
To make gentle or meek.
definitions.example: to tame a rebellion

definitions.definition: Not or no longer wild; domesticated
definitions.example: They have a tame wildcat.

definitions.definition: (chiefly of animals) Mild and well-behaved; accustomed to human contact
definitions.example: The lion was quite tame.

definitions.definition: Not exciting.
definitions.example: For a thriller, that film was really tame.

definitions.definition: Crushed; subdued; depressed; spiritless.
(of a knot) Capable of being represented as a finite closed polygonal chain.
To broach or enter upon; to taste, as a liquor; to divide; to distribute; to deal out.
Any dog bred, trained or used for the purpose of attacking a target, either on command or on sight; trained either as a specialized form of police dog or a security force dog.
A dog used in the bloodsport of dogfighting.
A person who engages in rhetorical attacks on behalf of another.
A person who fights physically on behalf of another
A general belief that bad things will happen.
The doctrine that this world is the worst of all possible worlds.
The condition of being pessimal.
One who relays confidential information to someone, especially to the police; an informer.

A native speaker who acts as a linguistic reference for a language being studied. The informant demonstrates native pronunciation, provides grammaticality judgments regarding linguistic well-formedness, and may also explain cultural references and other important contextual information.
Any of various edible European bivalve mollusks, of the family Cardiidae, having heart-shaped shells.
The shell of such a mollusk.
(in the plural) One’s innermost feelings (only in the expression “the cockles of one’s heart”).
(directly from French coquille) A wrinkle, pucker
(by extension) A defect in sheepskin; firm dark nodules caused by the bites of keds on live sheep
The mineral black tourmaline or schorl.
The fire chamber of a furnace.
A kiln for drying hops; an oast.
The dome of a heating furnace.
To cause to contract into wrinkles or ridges, as some kinds of cloth after a wetting; to pucker.
Any of several field weeds, such as the common corncockle (Agrostemma githago) and darnel ryegrass (Lolium temulentum).
A £10 note; a tenner.
A school which provides education for children in Key Stage 2, i.e. for four academic years from September after a child's 7th birthday.
An enclosure where pigs are kept.
A dirty or very untidy place.
Someone filled with or expressing grief or sadness, especially over a death; someone who mourns.
A misdemeanor larceny; an act of theft wherein the amount stolen is insufficient to constitute grand larceny.
A room in a university with many seats and a sloped floor, used to hold lectures.
Flight attendant (female), stewardess.
A break room in a public building or worksite.
A public lavatory.
The descending, warm, dry wind on the eastern side of the Rocky Mountains that generally blows from the southwest and can rapidly increase the temperature due to the much warmer air it brings.
The chinook salmon (Oncorhynchus tshawytscha).
To determine the value or worth of something, particularly as a person appointed for this purpose.
definitions.example: to appraise goods and chattels

definitions.definition: To consider comprehensively.
To judge the performance of someone, especially a worker.
definitions.example: At the end of the contract, you will be appraised by your line manager.

definitions.definition: To estimate; to conjecture.
To praise; to commend.
To apprise, inform.
Happening at the very end of an event.
An apparatus for measuring altitude.
A group of children who meet together for supervised play.
A group of gamers who meet together, especially for role-playing games.
A female prophet.
A surface cut or abrasion.
A line drawn on the ground, as one used in playing hopscotch.
A block for a wheel or other round object; a chock, wedge, prop, or other support, to prevent slipping.
definitions.example: a scotch for a wheel or a log on inclined ground

definitions.definition: To cut or score; to wound superficially.
To prevent (something) from being successful.
definitions.example: The rain scotched his plans of going to the beach.

definitions.definition: To debunk or discredit an idea or rumor.
definitions.example: The prime minister scotched rumors of his resignation.

definitions.definition: To block a wheel or other round object.
definitions.example: The workers stopped the rig on an incline and scotched the wheels.

definitions.definition: To dress (stone) with a pick or pointed instrument.
To beat yarn in order to break up slugs and align the threads.
definitions.example: Yarn is scotched immediately after it has been dried and while it is still warm. http//www.google.com/patents?id=DXdGAAAAEBAJ&pg=PP3&vq=scotched&dq=scotching

definitions.definition: To clothe or cover up.
(as a plural noun, the Scotch) The people of Scotland.
definitions.example: The Scotch are a hardy bunch.

definitions.definition: Whisky distilled in Scotland, especially from malted barley.
definitions.example: Paul has drunk a lot of Scotch.

definitions.definition: Any variety of Scotch.
definitions.example: My favorite Scotches are Glenlivet and Laphroaig.

definitions.definition: A glass of Scotch.
definitions.example: Gimme a Scotch.

definitions.definition: Of or from Scotland; Scottish.
Scotch tape
(Australian rhyming slang) To rape.
Having had shirt sleeves or pantlegs shortened by cutting material from the end.
The point at which something terminates or to which it is limited.
A road, path or channel that provides a shorter or quicker path; a shortcut.
A device that stops the flow of a current.
A device for saving steam by regulating its admission to the cylinder (see quotation at cut-off).
A cessation in a flow or activity.
The player who acts directly before the player on the button pre-flop.
(chiefly in the plural) shorts made by cutting off the legs from trousers
A horizontal line separating sections of the page.
A person who appears on a panel, either as a member of a committee or jury, or as part of a panel game.
The largest of the penguins, Aptenodytes forsteri, inhabits Antarctica
One who practices locksmithing
Someone who only bets when they are sure they will win
A long, loose-fitting coat or similar garment worn by some Muslim women to fulfil hijab.
The cultivation of a single crop at a time.
A culture or society that lacks diversity; a society marked by monoculturalism.
A relative measure of the quality of life a person or group has.
A tax levied on earned and unearned income, net of allowed deductions.
Any of several small chickens, especially of a breed that is a miniature version of another breed.
A competitor in an age division between peewee and midget.
Small or miniature.
Spirited or aggressive.
Space to stretch the legs while seated.
definitions.example: The lack of legroom on international flights can be a health hazard as blood clots can form from not being able to move around.

definitions.definition: Space to move in.
A reflexive jerking away.
definitions.example: My eye doctor hates the flinch I have every time he tries to get near my eyes.

definitions.definition: The slipping of the foot from a ball, when attempting to give a tight croquet.
To make a sudden, involuntary movement in response to a (usually negative) stimulus; to cringe.
To dodge (a question), to avoid an unpleasant task or duty
To let the foot slip from a ball, when attempting to give a tight croquet.
To strip the blubber or skin from, as from a whale, seal, etc.
Correct, satisfactory.
The area where something forks or branches, a ramification takes place.
definitions.example: There is a child sitting in a crotch of that tree.

definitions.definition: The ventral area (very bottom) of the human body between where the legs fork from the torso, in the area of the genitals and anus.
definitions.example: Every mile they rode their crotches felt worse saddlepain.

definitions.definition: Either the male or female genitalia.
definitions.example: He cringed at being kicked in the crotch.

definitions.definition: In the three-ball carom game, a small space at each corner of the table.
The open counter (negative space) formed by two downward strokes that meet at an internal acute angle, potentially above a vertex, as in the letters "V" and "Y".
To provide with a crotch; to give the form of a crotch to.
definitions.example: to crotch the ends of ropes in splicing or tying knots

definitions.definition: (logging, western US) To notch (a log) on opposite sides to provide a grip for the dogs that will haul it.
The quality of being liberal.
Any political movement founded on the autonomy and personal freedom of the individual, progress and reform, and government by law with the consent of the governed.
An economic ideology in favour of laissez faire and the free market (related to economic liberalism).
Any of several breeds of domestic cat with relatively short hair, slender body and large head.
A style of baroque architecture and decorative art, from 18th-century France, having elaborate ornamentation.
Of or relating to the rococo style.
Over-elaborate or complicated; opulent.
Old-fashioned.
To remove a person from one state to another by legal process.
In an angry manner; under the influence of anger.
definitions.example: "Leave me alone for once," she said angrily.

definitions.definition: To argue for a better deal, especially over prices with a seller.
definitions.example: I haggled for a better price because the original price was too high.

definitions.definition: To hack (cut crudely)
To stick at small matters; to chaffer; to higgle.
Deliberate or unintentional overstatement, particularly extreme overstatement.
An instance or example of such overstatement.
A hyperbola.
Goals for, a sports statistic
A female partner in an unmarried romantic relationship.
definitions.example: Marc went to the park with his girlfriend and watched the sunset with her.

definitions.definition: A female friend.
definitions.example: Mary always enjoyed hanging out with her girlfriend Jessica.

definitions.definition: A large surfboard, around 9 or 10 feet long with a wide nose.
definitions.example: In the past three weeks on Victoria's Surfcoast I've ridden my longboard probably 90% of the time as well. — Coastalwatch.com.au http//www.coastalwatch.com.au/news/news.aspx?newsId=55&newsType=admin&adType=news

definitions.definition: A large skateboard, measuring about 90 to 150 centimeters.
To travel by longboard.
A rigid carrying surface for an injured person, designed to prevent the movement of the spine during transportation in order to prevent further damage to it.
The head of the grip department, involved with lighting and camera movement.
Either of a pair of mirrors on the sides of a car or other vehicle that enable the driver to see to the side and behind.
definitions.example: I could see the dog running behind me in my wing mirror, but couldn't do anything about it.

definitions.definition: One who is enlisted, usually in a military service.
To enter on a list; to enroll; to register.
To join a cause or organization, especially military service.
definitions.example: The army wants potential soldiers to enlist.

definitions.definition: To recruit the aid or membership of others.
definitions.example: We enlisted fifty new members.

definitions.definition: To secure; to obtain.
definitions.example: They enlisted the government's support.

definitions.definition: A spread made from ground peanuts.
A unit of frequency equal to one thousand cycles per second; one thousand hertz
To gain popularity.
To penetrate the defence of the opposition.
To make or force a way through (a barrier)
A layer of cells between the xylem and the phloem that is responsible for the secondary growth of roots and stems.
Periosteum, a membrane that covers the outer surface of bones
One of the humours formerly believed to nourish the bodily organs.
(of a person or animal) Unable to distinguish between two or more primary colors (usually red and green).
(of a person or process) Holding no prejudice based on skin color or race; not paying attention to skin color.
Able to be related to something else; connected with.
definitions.example: The damage was relatable to the recent earthquake.

definitions.definition: Able to be related to on a personal level.
definitions.example: The characters in the play are very warm and relatable.

definitions.definition: Able to be passed on verbally; capable of being narrated or suitable for relating.
definitions.example: His verbal abuse was not relatable to polite ears.

definitions.definition: A hallucinogenic and intoxicating compound present in the peyote cactus (Lophophora williamsii), the San Pedro cactus (Echinopsis pachanoi), and the Peruvian torch (Echinopsis peruviana).
A little tower, frequently a merely ornamental structure at one of the corners of a building or castle.

A siege tower; a movable building, of a square form, consisting of ten or even twenty stories and sometimes one hundred and twenty cubits high, usually moved on wheels, and employed in approaching a fortified place, for carrying soldiers, engines, ladders, casting bridges, and other necessaries.
A tower-like solder post on a turret board (a circuit board with posts instead of holes).
An armoured, rotating gun installation on a fort, ship, aircraft, or armoured fighting vehicle.
The elevated central portion of the roof of a passenger car, with sides that are pierced for light and ventilation.
A market selling fresh meat, fish and produce.
A member of a mendicant Christian order such as the Augustinians, Carmelites (white friars), Franciscans (grey friars) or the Dominicans (black friars).
A white or pale patch on a printed page.
An American fish, the silverside.
Any one of various common types of small insects or animals which cause harm and annoyance.
definitions.example: The area was plagued by all sorts of vermin: fleas, lice, mice, and rats to name a few.

definitions.definition: Animals that prey on game, such as foxes or weasels.
Obnoxious, or mean and offensive person or people.
definitions.example: Bring these vermin to the Palace of Justice.

definitions.definition: Not breaching any constraints of the grammar, or morpho-syntax, of the relevant language.
definitions.example: Your writing is not grammatical enough for publication.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to grammar.
definitions.example: The writing was measured for both grammatical complexity and accuracy factors.
